recipes: [{"matched_recipe_title": "Appam", "summary": "Appam is a soft, lacy-edged pancake popular in South Indian cuisine, typically made from fermented rice and coconut milk batter. It's often served with a variety of side dishes like sambar, coconut chutney, and egg curry.", "servings": 4, "total_time_minutes": 60, "materials": {"ingredients": [{"name": "rice", "quantity": "1 3/4", "unit": "cups", "notes": "cooked and cooled"}, {"name": "urad dal (split black gram)", "quantity": "1/2", "unit": "cups", "notes": "soaked for 4 hours"}, {"name": "coconut", "quantity": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "grated"}, {"name": "fenugreek seeds", "quantity": "1/2", "unit": "tsp", "notes": "soaked for 1 hour"}, {"name": "green chili", "quantity": "1", "unit": "", "notes": "slid"}, {"name": "ginger", "quantity": "1/2", "unit": "tsp", "notes": "grated"}, {"name": "salt", "quantity": "1/2", "unit": "tsp", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "quantity": "as needed", "unit": "", "notes": "to make a smooth batter"}, {"name": "coconut milk", "quantity": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": "frothy"}], "equipment": ["mixing bowl", "blender or grinder", "non-stick pan or appam pan", "ladle"]}, "steps": ["In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked rice, soaked urad dal, grated coconut, fenugreek seeds, green chili, ginger, and salt. Mix well.", "Add water gradually to form a smooth, slightly thick batter. It should be similar in consistency to thick yogurt.", "Let the batter rest for at least 5 hours or overnight to ferment.", "After fermentation, add 1 cup of frothy coconut milk to the batter and mix thoroughly.", "Pour a ladleful of the batter onto a preheated non-stick appam pan, tilt the pan to spread the batter thinly.", "Cook on medium heat until the edges form lacy patterns and the center is slightly undercooked. Flip the appam and cook the other side briefly.", "Repeat the process for the remaining batter. They are light, fluffy, and made by cooking a thin layer of batter on a hot griddle.", "servings": 4, "total_time_minutes": 30, "materials": {"ingredients": [{"name": "rice flour", "quantity": "2", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "water", "quantity": "1 1/2", "unit": "cups", "notes": "as needed for thin batter"}, {"name": "salt", "quantity": "1/2", "unit": "tsp", "notes": ""}, {"name": "oil or ghee", "quantity": "1", "unit": "tbsp", "notes": "for greasing the pan"}], "equipment": ["mixing bowl", "non-stick pan or chira pan", "ladle or small bowl"]}, "steps": ["Mix rice flour with water gradually to form a smooth, thin batter. Each layer is steamed separately and alternated in color for a visually appealing result.", "servings": 8, "total_time_minutes": 120, "materials": {"ingredients": [{"name": "rice flour", "quantity": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "coconut milk", "quantity": "1", "unit": "cup", "notes": ""}, {"name": "pandan leaves", "quantity": "10-12", "unit": "", "notes": "chopped and cooked to extract juice"}, {"name": "lime juice", "quantity": "1", "unit": "tbsp", "notes": ""}, {"name": "sugar", "quantity": "1/2", "unit": "cups", "notes": ""}, {"name": "baking powder", "quantity": "1 1/2", "unit": "tsp", "notes": ""}, {"name": "food coloring (green, red, yellow)", "quantity": "a few drops", "unit": "", "notes": "per layer"}], "equipment": ["steamer", "mixing bowl", "ladle", "whisk"]}, "steps": ["In a mixing bowl, combine rice flour, coconut milk, pandan juice, lime juice, sugar, and baking powder.
